A filter is applied to this layer using: A filter is applied to this layer using a CQL2 query. Only features matching this query will be included in clipping.
Are you sure you want to delete this geo: Are you sure you want to delete this geography?
Are you sure you want to discard your ch: Are you sure you want to discard your changes?
Choose a layer as a base for your Geogra: Choose a layer as a base for your Geography. Layers with multiple features will produce multiple Geographies. You may select from the list of existing Overlays, or upload a new vector layer.
Choose an attribute to use as a unique i: Choose an attribute to use as a unique identifier for your Geographies
Choose an overlay layer to use as a clip: Choose an overlay layer to use as a clipping boundary for this geography.
Choose from an existing overlay or uploa: Choose from an existing overlay or upload a new polygon layer that represents a geography
Create a Nearshore Territorial Sea Geogr: Create a Nearshore Territorial Sea Geography
Create a separate Geography for each {{t: Create a separate Geography for each {{type}}
Create a single Geography representing t: Create a single Geography representing the 12nm Territorial Sea boundary.
Create geographies representing Exclusiv: Create geographies representing Exclusive Economic Zones and Territorial Seas
Design and evaluate sketches on land usi: Design and evaluate sketches on land using OpenStreetMap
Geographies represent spatial areas wher: Geographies represent spatial areas where sketches can be drawn and define regions where you would like to aggregate metrics for reporting. Your project can use built-in land and eez layers to start with, and add custom boundary layers if needed.
Geographies will be created to represent: Geographies will be created to represent the 0-12nm and 12-200nm areas.
Geography creation for this layer is dis: Geography creation for this layer is disabled because it has > 10 individual features and would create too many Geographies. If you need to create a Geography that has more than one polygon, use desktop GIS to create a MultiPolygon layer. Contact <2>support@seasketch.org</2> if you need help.
If enabled, OpenStreetMap coastline data: If enabled, OpenStreetMap coastline data will be used to remove land from sketches drawn within this geography.
If enabled, OpenStreetMap coastline data will be used to remove land from sketches drawn within this geography. Only enable if your features are not already clipped to land.
Name: Name
Nations may have more than one polygon a: Nations may have more than one polygon associated with their EEZ. You should select all those where users will be doing planning within this project. Use the list below to select areas, or click polygons on the map.
Only area within this layer will be incl: Only area within this layer will be included in the geography.
Only include the selected Exclusive Econ: Only include the selected Exclusive Economic Zones.
Or, create a Geography using authoritati: Or, create a Geography using authoritative data sources
Please enter a name for the geography.
Recommended. Use this option if Sketches: Recommended. Use this option if Sketches will be confined to a single {{type}}, or if you need to summarize reporting metrics by individual zones. You may still aggregate metrics for all {{type}}s in reports.
Represent areas beyond national jurisdic: Represent areas beyond national jurisdiction using data from MarineRegions.org
SeaSketch has not been configured correc: SeaSketch has not been configured correctly with MARINE_REGIONS_EEZ_LAND_JOINED, MARINE_REGIONS_TERRITORIAL_SEA and DAYLIGHT_COASTLINE layers. Contact <9>support@seasketch.org</9> for assistance. Documentation on updating template layers is online at <13>https://github.com/seasketch/next/wiki/Data-Library#assigning-data-library-template-ids</13>
Select all those where users will be doi: Select all those where users will be doing planning within this project. Use the list below to select areas, or click polygons on the map.
Select one or more Exclusive Economic Zo: Select one or more Exclusive Economic Zones
Select one or more Territorial Seas: Select one or more Territorial Seas
The SeaSketch team maintains an updated: The SeaSketch team maintains an updated copy of this authoritative data for use in your projects.
These layers define the bounds of this g: These layers define the bounds of this geography, performing intersection or difference operations against user-drawn sketches. You will usually want one intersection layer to define the geography bounds and one or more difference layers to remove areas from that primary layer.
This action cannot be undone. Related da: This action cannot be undone. Related data layers will remain in the table of contents until you remove them.
This area will be removed from the geogr: This area will be removed from the geography.
This geography can be used to clip sketc: This geography can be used to clip sketches exclusively to areas beyond national jurisdiction and is based on data from <2>MarineRegions.org</2>.
This layer is already used in this geogr: This layer is already used in this geography and cannot be selected.
This name is visible within the administ: This name is visible within the administrative interface when configuring sketch classes, and used as a default label if this geography if used in reports.
This timeline shows the time spent in ea: This timeline shows the time spent in each step of the clipping process. Hover over bars for details.
Use this option if you plan to have Sket: Use this option if you plan to have Sketches which span multiple zones.
Warning: No attributes found with unique: Warning: No attributes found with unique values for each feature. Each Geography requires a unique identifier.
